member.summary: Public constructor for ClientSideEvents object

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.ClientSideEvents.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties of the class to their default values.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset all properties of the ClientSideEvents class to their default values.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.ClientSideEvents.CopyFrom(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.ClientSideEvents)
member.summary: Copies the ClientSideEvents object

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.ClientSideEvents.Click
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called when a button is clicked on the client.

remarks.p: The name of the JavaScript function can be user defined or native. For example, to specify that the native function alert should be called, this property could be set to "alert('hello')." To specify that a user-defined function, myFunction, should be called, this property would be set to "myFunction."
A user-defined function must be defined either inline or in a linked JavaScript (.JS) file and can accept the following parameters:

dd.p: Object. The CSOM toolbar object calling the function.
Object. The CSOM object of the button that was clicked.

remarks.p: The parameters above are optional and can be named as desired.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.ClientSideEvents.InitializeToolbar
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called when the internal document object model is being initialized on the client.

remarks.p: The name of the JavaScript function can be user defined or native. For example, to specify that the native function alert should be called, this property could be set to "alert('hello')." To specify that a user-defined function, myFunction, should be called, this property would be set to "myFunction."
A user-defined function must be defined either inline or in a linked JavaScript (.JS) file, above where the UltraWebToolbar control is defined on the page, and can accept the following parameters:

dd.p: Object. The CSOM toolbar object calling the function.

remarks.p: The parameters above are optional and can be named as desired.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.ClientSideEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called when the cursor enters a button of the toolbar on the client.

remarks.p: The name of the JavaScript function can be user defined or native. For example, to specify that the native function alert should be called, this property could be set to "alert('hello')." To specify that a user-defined function, myFunction, should be called, this property would be set to "myFunction."
A user-defined function must be defined either inline or in a linked JavaScript (.JS) file and can accept the following parameters:

dd.p: Object. The CSOM toolbar object calling the function.
Object. The CSOM object of the button the cursor entered.

remarks.p: The parameters above are optional and can be named as desired.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.ClientSideEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called when the cursor leaves a button of the toolbar on the client.

remarks.p: The name of the JavaScript function can be user defined or native. For example, to specify that the native function alert should be called, this property could be set to "alert('hello')." To specify that a user-defined function, myFunction, should be called, this property would be set to "myFunction."
A user-defined function must be defined either inline or in a linked JavaScript (.JS) file and can accept the following parameters:

dd.p: Object. The CSOM toolbar object calling the function.
Object. The CSOM object of the button the cursor left.

remarks.p: The parameters above are optional and can be named as desired.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.ClientSideEvents.ViewState
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information (StateBag) that allows you to save and restore the view state of a server control across multiple requests for the same page.

remarks.p: A server control's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. In order to preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. For more information about saving server control view state, see Maintaining State in a Control.

summary.para: A custom Type Editor for class styles. This editor allows the style class names to be added to a list from which the user can select. This is possible because the property grid is signed with a "reflection" permission that allows for private reflection.
Creates a list box to show in the property grid.
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The property grid will call this when it wants to display the editor for the given value.
Private function to fill the contents of our list box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The editor style indicates what type of editor we are providing: we can either display a dialog or a drop-down box. Our editor always shows a drop-down box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor and indicates if we support painting a small representation of our value in the property grid.
Called when the user clicks something in the list box. We close the drop down at this time.
Owner draw list box displays classess in the list box
We override this from Control so we can designate that the return key should be used for input. In other words, we want return to come to us, not be treated as the "OK" to dismiss a dialog.
We handle keyboard processing here for the return key. We treat this key like a click on the list box.
A custom Type Editor for the tree. This Editor invokes a FileDialog for retrieving url paths
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The property grid will call this when it wants to display the editor for the given value.
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The editor style indicates what type of editor we are providing: we can either display a dialog or a drop-down box. Our editor always shows a drop-down box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor and indicates if we support painting a small representation of our value in the property grid.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.Items
member.summary: The collection of Items which belong to the UltraWebToolbar object. The objects in this collection may be one of several different types. These types include: TBarButton, TBButtonGroup, TBCustom, TBLabel, TBSeparator, TBTextBox. All types except for TBCustom are derived from TBObject. The TBCustom type is derived from WebControl in order to allow other ASP.NET controls to be hosted within it. Care must be taken when accessing the Items collection to ensure that invalide assignments do not cause an exception.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.Items.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of this collection.

remarks.p: This method will create a new collection and create clones of each item in the original collection, and add them to the new Items collection.
Note: Any custom objects () will not be deep cloned, instead a reference will be added to the original object.

member.returns: A deep copy of this Items collection.

member.summary: Returns the object located at the specified index.

Note: Indexes start at 0, and can not be negative.

members.member: Class for representing rectangular coordinates and allowing them to be displayed and edited in the PropertyGrid.

summary.p: Returns a string representation of an object.
Returns a Boolean value that determines whether an object is set to Nothing or Null.

returns.p: True, if the object is set to Nothing or Null; otherwise, False.

summary.p: Copies a specified object's property settings to an object.

param.name: rect
param.p: A reference to the source Rectangle object, from which the property values are received.

summary.p: Returns or sets a value that determines the y-coordinate of the top edge of a Rectangle object.

remarks.p: The Bottom property returns or sets the y-coordinate of the bottom edge of a Rectangle object.
The Left property returns or sets the x-coordinate of the left edge of a Rectangle object.
The Right property returns or sets the x-coordinate of the right edge of a Rectangle object.

summary.p: Returns or sets a value that determines the x-coordinate of the left edge of a Rectangle object.

remarks.p: The Right property returns or sets the x-coordinate of the right edge of a Rectangle object.
The Top property returns or sets the y-coordinate of the top edge of a Rectangle object.
The Bottom property returns or sets the y-coordinate of the bottom edge of a Rectangle object.

summary.p: Returns or sets a value that determines the x-coordinate of the right edge of a Rectangle object.

remarks.p: The Left property returns or sets the x-coordinate of the left edge of a Rectangle object.
The Top property returns or sets the y-coordinate of the top edge of a Rectangle object.
The Bottom property returns or sets the y-coordinate of the bottom edge of a Rectangle object.

summary.p: Returns or sets a value that determines the y-coordinate of the bottom edge of a Rectangle object.

remarks.p: The Top property returns or sets the y-coordinate of the top edge of a Rectangle object.
The Left property returns or sets the x-coordinate of the left edge of a Rectangle object.
The Right property returns or sets the x-coordinate of the right edge of a Rectangle object.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.Style
member.summary: Class for implementing CSS style attributes and functionality

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the URL of an image to be displayed in the background of an object.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the CSS class to render the object on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS background-image:url attribute.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines additional CSS rules to apply to the object.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the CSS class to render the object on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS padding attribute.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the type of cursor displayed for an object when the mouse pointer is over it.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the cursor to use for the object on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS cursor attribute.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the Margin object that determines the amount of space for an object's margins.

remarks.p: Margins can be set for the entire object or for one or more of its sides.
Use this property to specify the margins to render the object with on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS margin attribute.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the Padding object that determines the amount of space to insert between an object and its margin.

remarks.p: Padding can be set for the entire object or for one or more of its sides.
Use this property to specify the padding to render the object with on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS padding attribute.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton
member.summary: The TBarButton object is the mos common type of item used in the toolbar. It renders like a button that the user can press to invoke a command. The TBarButton behaves much like an HTML button, but gives you the ability to include images, keep state, and customize borders.

remarks.p: When Enabled is set to false, a button's appearance will stay static. No or will be applied. If the property is set, that image will be displayed instead of the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.Selected
member.summary: Determines if a button is currently selected or not.

remarks.p: If the button belongs to a , the group's will be set to this button.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.Text
member.summary: The text which will be displayed when this button is rendered.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.Image
member.summary: A relative path to the Image which should be displayed for this button.

remarks.p: When set, this image will be displayed along with the button's . If the button is , the will be displayed, if set.
Note: If the property is set, this path should be relative to the ImageDirectory.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.TargetFrame
member.summary: Used to determine what frame the should be displayed in.

remarks.p: You can specify an HTML frame, an object such as an IFrame, or use "_blank" to launch in a new window.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.TargetURL
member.summary: A URL which will be navigated to, when this button is clicked.

remarks.p: When set, the TargetURL will be displayed in the frame specified by the property. The TargetUrl should be fully qualifyied, for example "http://www.infragistics.com". You can also use this property to make a script call. For example:
TargetURL="javascript:myFunction()";

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.DisabledImage
member.summary: A relative path to the Image which should be displayed for this button when =False.

remarks.p: When set, this image will be displayed along with the button's , if the button is disabled (=False).
Note: If the property is set, this path should be relative to the ImageDirectory.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.ToolTip
member.summary: The text which should be displayed when this object is moused over.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.ImageAlign
member.summary: If an image should be displayed, this determines the alignment of it. All alignment settings are with respect to the text of the item.

remarks.p: Note: Certain settings, such as Right, may cause undesired results, due to the way browsers position the image.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.ToggleButton
member.summary: Determines if the button should keep its state. When true, the button will remain depressed after first being clicked. Clicking the button again will restore the button to its normal state.

remarks.p: Setting this to True, will cause the button to be selected on the first click, and the second click will unselect the button. When set to False, a button will only stay selected while the mouse button is pressed down.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.DefaultStyle
member.summary: The style which will be used when rendering this button in the UltraWebToolbar.

remarks.p: The DefaultStyle is the style which is applied to a button when not selected, or moused over. When set, DefaultStyle overrides , on the UltraWebToolbar object. If the button is part of a , this style overrides the TBButtonGroup's . To force the UltraWebToolbar to your your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.HoverStyle
member.summary: The style which will be used when this button is moused over.

remarks.p: The HoverStyle is the style which is applied to a button when moused over, if not . If the button is part of a , this style overrides the TBButtonGroup's . When set, HoverStyle overrides , on the UltraWebToolbar object. To force the UltraWebToolbar to your your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBarButton.SelectedStyle
member.summary: The style which will be used when this button is .

remarks.p: The SelectedStyle is the style which is applied to a button when . If the button is part of a , this style overrides the TBButtonGroup's . When set, SelectedStyle overrides , on the UltraWebToolbar object. To force the UltraWebToolbar to your your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBButtonGroup
member.summary: A ButtonGroup represents a series of items which maintain a mutually exclusive selection state. Only one button within the group is depressed at one time.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBButtonGroup.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of this object.
member.returns: A deep copy of this object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBButtonGroup.#ctor
member.summary: Default Constructor, initializes an empty collection of buttons.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBButtonGroup.ToString
member.summary: A description of the object.
member.returns: Provides a short description of the object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBButtonGroup.SelectedButton
member.summary: A reference to the selected button in this group.

remarks.p: Setting this property will also set the button's property to the proper value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBButtonGroup.Buttons
member.summary: The collection of buttons which belong to this group.

remarks.p: This property will return a collection of objects. You can use this property to access any of the buttons which belong to this group. For example, the following would return the first button in the group.
TBarButton myButton=buttongroup.Buttons[0]; //buttongroup is a object

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBButtonGroup.DefaultStyle
member.summary: The style which will be used when rendering a button in this group.

remarks.p: The DefaultStyle is the style which is applied to a button in this group, when not selected, or moused over. When set, DefaultStyle overrides , on the UltraWebToolbar object, and is overridden by on the object. To force the UltraWebToolbar to your your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBButtonGroup.HoverStyle
member.summary: The style which will be used when a button in this group is moused over.

remarks.p: The HoverStyle is the style which is applied to a button in this group when moused over, if not . When set, HoverStyle overrides , on the UltraWebToolbar object, and is overridden by on the object. To force the UltraWebToolbar to your your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.TBButtonGroup.SelectedStyle
member.summary: The style which will be used when a button in this group is clicked.

remarks.p: The SelectedStyle is the style which is applied to a button in this group when . When set, SelectedStyle overrides , on the UltraWebToolbar object, and is overridden by on the object. If the button's property is true, the SelectedStyle will be present until the button is clicked again. Otherwise, the SelectedStyle only lasts as long as the mouse button is pressed down. To force the UltraWebToolbar to your your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.CheckItems.Item(System.Int32)

Note: Indexes start at 0, and can not be negative.

summary.para: A custom Type Editor for the nodes collection. This Editor invokes a dialog for editing nodes and children
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The property grid will call this when it wants to display the editor for the given value.
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The editor style indicates what type of editor we are providing: we can either display a dialog or a drop-down box. Our editor always shows a drop-down box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor and indicates if we support painting a small representation of our value in the property grid.

summary.p: Used to determine what type of HTML should be rendered.
Determine what type of HTML to render, by finding out the browser type and version.
Render HTML that can be seen in a DownLevel browser only. This setting is useful to determine what a downlevel browser will see, without having one installed on your machine.
Render HTML that will only display properly in an UpLevel browser, which supports DHTML.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.GroupButtonEvent
member.summary: Event object for events from TBButtonGroup objects. The TBButtonGroup object contain a collection of TBarButton objects that act as a group. member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.ControlStyle
member.summary: Overrides the WebControl ControlStyle property to return a Style of type Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.Style containing additional style properties.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.MergeStyles
member.summary: Determines if Hover and Selected styles will automatically be merged with the DefaultStyle of the Toolbar and Toolbar Items.

remarks.p: When this property is set to true, the Hover and Selected styles will take on the values of the default style unless overridden for particular property values.
By default, this property is set to true so that style settings are blended automatically.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.RenderAnchors
member.summary: Determines whether a button's should be rendered as an HTML Anchor tag.

remarks.p: If the is not specified, the anchor will not be rendered. In a downlevel browser, anchors will always be rendered.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.ItemWidthDefault
member.summary: Determines the default width of items within the toolbar when not explicitly set within the item's default style. When this property is not set and the Item.Style.Width is also not set, the widths of items are automatically determined by the browser to occupy the horizontal width of the toolbar equally for each item. To set the widths of individual items, use the DefaultStyle.Width property setting.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.ItemPadding
member.summary: Determines the amount of CellPadding used for the HTML Table that contains the toolbar items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.ItemSpacing
member.summary: Determines the amount of CellSpacing used for the HTML Table that contains the toolbar items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.TextAlign
member.summary: Determines the alignment of the items within the toolbar. Values for this property include Left, Right, Center and Justified.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.BackgroundImage
member.summary: An image Url that specifies an image to be displayed on the background of the toolbar. This image will appear wherever there is space not occupied by other toolbar items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.OnTop
member.summary: Determines the Z-Index placement of the UltraWebToolbar.

remarks.p: When set to true, the UltraWebToolbar will always be rendered as the topmost object. This is especially useful when is set to true, so that the user always see the entire toolbar.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.BrowserTarget
member.summary: Sets which type of browser the html should be rendered for. Possible values are: Auto (Default), UpLevel, DownLevel.

summary.p: The image which when clicked on, will allow the UltraWebTool bar to be repositioned.

remarks.p: If this is not set, a vertical bar will be drawn by default.
Note: The image is only rendered if is set to True.

summary.p: The default style used for any item in the UltraWebToolbar.

remarks.p: This style is overridden by the item's DefaultStyle.

summary.p: The style to be applied to a TBarButton item when moused over.

remarks.p: By default, the only object which supports a HoverStyle is the .

summary.p: A relative path to the JavaScript file.

remarks.p: The default JavaScript file is ig_webtoolbar.js. By default, this file is located in a virtual directory called /ig_webbars2_scripts.
Note: The JavaScript file is required for the UltraWebToolbar to function properly at runtime.

summary.p: A relative path to the Infragistics common JavaScript file.

remarks.p: The default common JavaScript file is ig_csom.js and is located in a virtual directory called /ig_common/scripts.
Note: The common JavaScript file is required for the UltraWebToolbar to function properly at runtime.

summary.p: A directory where images can be found.

remarks.p: When this property is set, any image specified for an UltraWebToolbar item, will be relative to this directory.
To specify an image in the current application directory, use a ./ prefix for the image name as in: ./myimage.gif

summary.p: The collection of items for this UltraWebToolbar. The Items collections can be made up of different object types depending on requirements. The most common type is the TBarButton. Other types include: TBButtonGroup, TBLabel, TBSeparator, TBTextBox and TBCustom. All types, with the exception of TBCustom, derive from a common base type: TBObject. The TBCustom type derives from System.Web.UI.Control in order to support child controls.

remarks.p: This collection is created when the UltraWebToolbar is created.
This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.ClientSideEvents
member.summary: Object holder for client-side event names.

remarks.p: Client-side events are events that occur in the web-browser, such as mouse-related events. Because the events are local to the browser, they must be implemented in JavaScript. Client-side events do not require a new connection to the server or a refresh of the current page. The other type of events found in the UltraWebToolbar are server-side events. These events require the browser to make a new connection with the server in response to some event that occurs at the control level on the server, such as the addition of a new row of data.
When you are implementing client-side events in your application, your JavaScript routines should use the names provided by the ClientSideEvents property.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.ButtonClickedEventHandler
member.summary: Event handler signature for the ButtonClicked event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebToolbar.UltraWebToolbar.GroupButtonClickedEventHandler
member.summary: Event handler signature for the GroupButtonClicked event.
